page.title: 09POOLS AND PONDS IN THE AREA.
page.content: There are 110 pools and ponds in the D block which we are doing for our survey.Two of the ponds are called the Rookery because there are lots of trees around the ponds.The trees have got rooks nests in them. The ponds are man made.They are there because the farmers used to get Marl out of the earth and put it on thei fields to make the wheat grow. These holes were called MARL PITS. They have now filled with water and have turned into attractive pools with trees and bushes around them. Some of the ponds have been stocked with fish and have become private fishing waters.
